# jsdoc/require-returns-type

<div class="rule-meta">
</div>

### What it does

Requires that `@returns` tag has a type value (in curly brackets).

### Why is this bad?

A `@returns` tag should have a type value.

### Example

```javascript
// Passing
/** @returns {string} */
function quux(foo) {}

// Failing
/** @returns */
function quux(foo) {}
```
